comments.creator: mozilla@misc.lka.org.lu
comments.text:
Currently, there is no way within Thunderbird's config GUI to remove unneeded dictionaries (such as the 100 variants of english spelling by different countries... for most users en_GB and en_US should be more than enough, and the other only clutter up the list... it's hard to hunt for German or French among the thousands of variants of English). There is a "manual" way documented at http://kb.mozillazine.org/Dictionaries_%28Thunderbird%29#Uninstalling_a_dictionary

However, while this is feasible for the user's personal dictionaries, it is iffy for system dictionaries. Even if the admin removed the extraneous dictionaries from /usr/share/myspell, they would pop up again at the next update of hunspell-en

A way in thunderbird to "blacklist" unneeded system directories would be more stable.
